decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing efficient threats like Spyglass Siren and Preacher of the Schism, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of cards like Enduring Curiosity and Restless Reef provide card advantage and versatility, making it a flexible and powerful aggro deck that can adapt to different strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Omniscience combo to cast high-cost spells for free, such as Roiling Dragonstorm and Floodfarm Verge. Marang River Regent and Moment of Truth provide additional value and card draw to keep the combo going. Cards like Ephara's Dispersal and Stock Up help control the board and provide protection. The deck also includes some counter spells and removal options for added versatility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures while controlling the game tempo.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing a combination of mana acceleration, aggressive creatures like Skirmish Rhino and Sunpearl Kirin, and disruptive spells such as Nowhere to Run and Severance Priest, the deck aims to put early pressure on the opponent and control the battlefield. The inclusion of Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Overlord of the Balemurk offers additional late-game threats to seal the victory. The land base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive strategy and ensure consistent mana sources.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It aims to play aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter while using spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to push for damage. The deck also utilizes cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand to draw into more threats and maintain pressure. By combining efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly by playing aggressive creatures and controlling the board with removal spells. By playing cards like Fear of Isolation and This Town Ain't Big Enough, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. The deck also utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Preacher of the Schism and Sunpearl Kirin to close out the game quickly. With a mix of aggression and control elements, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to have a strong early game presence with cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Heartfire Hero, while also maintaining a solid late game with powerful finishers like Monstrous Rage and Emberheart Challenger. By combining aggressive creatures with direct damage spells, the deck is able to apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to colored sources for all spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, along with efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure to the opponent. Additionally, card draw and selection cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand help maintain momentum and ensure a steady flow of threats. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive strategy by providing a mix of red and blue sources.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, backed up by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to push through damage. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming opponents before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of cheap creatures and efficient spells. Cards like Novice Inspector and Spyglass Siren provide early game presence while Warden of the Inner Sky and Floodpits Drowner offer more power in the mid to late game. The deck also includes a variety of control elements like Spell Pierce and Sheltered by Ghosts to help protect your board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Elspeth, Storm Slayer serves as a powerful finisher while Stock Up and Regal Bunnicorn provide card advantage to keep the pressure on.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to control the battlefield by efficiently removing threats with removal spells and protecting its key creatures with protection spells. By curving out with low-cost aggressive creatures and using burn spells to finish off the opponent or clear the way for attacks, this deck can quickly put pressure on the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and efficient burn spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By playing early threats like Emberheart Challenger and Hired Claw, followed by backing them up with direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Screaming Nemesis and Monstrous Rage further increases the deck's potential for explosive damage output, making it a formidable force in the early game.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with fast and efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Manifold Mouse. The deck also includes powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to quickly finish off the opponent. Additionally, cards like Monstrous Rage and Tersa Lightshatter help create overwhelming board presence. The mana base is streamlined with mostly Mountains and utility lands like Rockface Village and Soulstone Sanctuary to ensure consistent early aggression.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm opponents with a heavy offensive strategy using aggressive red creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Heartfire Hero, and Hired Claw. Supporting cards like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage provide additional damage output, while cards like Tersa Lightshatter and Screaming Nemesis disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently, utilizing the speed and power of the red aggro archetype to secure victories in 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently utilizing cheap spells like Burst Lightning and Stormchaser's Talent, as well as creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, the deck aims to maintain a constant stream of pressure on the opponent. In addition, cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand help ensure consistency in drawing into more threats and answers. The mana base is carefully constructed to allow for smooth casting of spells from both red and blue sources.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Slickshot Show-Off, and Cori-Steel Cutter. It aims to deal damage efficiently with instant spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. Opt and Sleight of Hand help to dig for additional threats or removal. Wrenn's Resolve and Stormchaser's Talent provide buffs to our creatures, while Into the Flood Maw and Stock Up can help refill our hand. The mana base is streamlined to ensure we have the right colors available to cast our spells on curve.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plays through a combination of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer, as well as spells like Ride's End and Temporary Lockdown. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Up the Beanstalk and utilize lands like Hushwood Verge and Lush Portico for added advantage. The inclusion of a variety of lands and spells allows for versatility in gameplay and strategic decision making to outplay the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence through aggressive plays. It aims to quickly eliminate threats with removal spells like Go for the Throat, while also deploying evasive creatures like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat to chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Phantom Interference and Intimidation Tactics to control the pace of the game. Overall, the deck combines aggression and disruption to outpace and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced match.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By combining efficient creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Sunpearl Kirin with disruptive spells like Fear of Isolation and Duress, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent. This deck also includes powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Stormchaser's Talent to close out the game quickly. The mana base is carefully optimized to support the aggressive playstyle while still being able to cast all spells efficiently. This deck thrives on speed and disruption to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various cards that allow for removal, card draw, and life gain. The deck aims to control the board state through cards like Day of Judgment and Lightning Helix, while also having ways to draw cards and gain life with Jeskai Revelation and Beza, the Bounding Spring. The deck also includes cards like Split Up and Stock Up to provide flexibility and options in different situations. Overall, the goal is to outlast and outvalue the opponent while controlling the game.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on stalling and disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and controlling the board. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. The deck also includes threats like Marang River Regent and Beza, the Bounding Spring to pressure the opponent and close out the game. By managing resources effectively and making strategic decisions, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing various spells to control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and draw cards to maintain card advantage. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by efficiently managing their resources and answering threats effectively. The deck also includes a mix of creatures that provide additional value or support the control game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game with a combination of removal, disruption, and card advantage until the player can secure a win condition.

The main strategy of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game by using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. It also includes a few win conditions such as Jace, the Perfected Mind and Marang River Regent. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent by efficiently using its resources and answering threats as they arise. Additionally, it focuses on mana fixing and ramping with the use of dual lands and cantrips to ensure consistency in its game plan.

This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and efficient spells. It aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Spell Pierce and Recommission. The deck also includes some card draw and recursion to ensure that it can maintain its momentum throughout the game. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and efficiency in order to secure victories before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature strategies, utilizing a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Marauding Mako with powerful spells like Torch the Tower and Profit's Eidetic Memory, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Tersa Lightshatter helps to control the board and protect your creatures, while also providing opportunities for tempo swings in your favor.

This deck aims to utilize various spells and abilities to quickly and efficiently ramp up mana and control the board, leading up to a game-changing play with Omniscience. By effectively managing resources and utilizing cards like Moment of Truth and Roiling Dragonstorm, the player can overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck also includes counterspells and removal to maintain board control, while cards like Marang River Regent provide additional late-game threats. Overall, the deck focuses on achieving a powerful combo with Omniscience to dominate the game.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on generating early pressure with small creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Preacher of the Schism before ramping up to more powerful threats like Sunpearl Kirin and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes disruptive pieces like Hopeless Nightmare and Temporary Lockdown to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently in order to secure victories in a fast-paced, aggressive fashion.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's plans and locking down the board with a combination of removal spells and creatures. The deck includes cards like Temporary Lockdown, Nowhere to Run, and Momentum Breaker to control the game state. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption while powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Sunpearl Kirin offer a way to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support a smooth curve and ensure consistent access to both white and black mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, dealing damage efficiently and swiftly. By playing low-cost creatures with abilities like haste and damage boosts, along with direct damage spells, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of lands that provide additional benefits such as mana ramp or card draw helps to maintain momentum and pressure on the opponent. It is designed to be fast-paced and relentless in its pursuit of victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while utilizing spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to deal damage and control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and direct damage spells, often finishing off the game with powerful finishers like Screaming Nemesis or Stormchaser's Talent. The inclusion of card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand helps ensure consistency and keeps the aggression going.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a mix of creatures, burn spells, and card draw. By using low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Opt and Sleight of Hand help to filter through the deck for key cards, while cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Stock Up provide additional value and card advantage. With a mana base that supports the deck's aggressive strategy, this UR Aggro deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and tempo plays, utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower to control the board and deal damage to the opponent quickly. The deck also includes cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Cori-Steel Cutter to pressure the opponent while maintaining card advantage through spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand. The key strategy is to apply continuous pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Spell Pierce, and close out the game efficiently with a mix of burn and creature damage.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of cheap spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Burst Lightning, Monstrous Rage, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing to ensure a smooth curve and consistent aggression. With a focus on speed and efficiency, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible through relentless aggression and burn spells.
